modules.description: Computes ED25519 public keys from 32-byte secret keys and verifies or generates signatures using 32-byte keys and messages. Operates on raw byte sequences represented as type t, ensuring cryptographic validity through strict length checks. Used to generate signatures for authenticated messages and validate signatures against expected public keys.

Computes ED25519 public keys from 32-byte secret keys, verifies 64-byte signatures against 32-byte public keys, and generates signatures using a message, secret key, and associated public key. Operates on 32-byte raw key and signature values represented as type t. Used for cryptographic authentication in secure messaging protocols where signature verification and key derivation are required.

Converts bytes to hexadecimal buffers, parses hexadecimal buffers into 32-byte and 12-byte arrays, and handles encoding errors. Operates on byte buffers and individual byte elements. Used for cryptographic key parsing and network protocol data conversion.

Computes ED25519 signatures and public keys from 32-byte inputs, operating on raw byte sequences of fixed length. Provides functions to generate signatures, verify them against public keys, and derive public keys from secret keys. Accepts messages and keys as type t, enforcing strict length constraints for cryptographic correctness. Examples include signing a message with a secret key and verifying the signature using the corresponding public key.

Converts bytes to hexadecimal buffers, parses hexadecimal buffers into 32-byte and 12-byte arrays, and handles encoding errors. Operates on byte buffers and individual byte elements. Used for cryptographic key parsing and network protocol data conversion.

Computes ED25519 public keys from 32-byte secret keys, verifies 64-byte signatures against 32-byte public keys, and generates signatures using a message, secret key, and associated public key. Operations work with 32-byte raw key and signature values of type t. Examples include authenticating messages in secure communications and verifying sender identity through signature validation. Key functions enable cryptographic authentication and key derivation in protocols requiring strong digital signatures.

Generates random byte sequences of a specified length, using an optional identifier for deterministic testing. Operates on integers and strings to produce Bytes.t values. Used to create reproducible test data in controlled environments while ensuring true randomness in production.

Encodes and decodes hexadecimal data into fixed-size byte arrays, enabling cryptographic key handling and protocol data manipulation. Performs ED25519 signature generation, verification, and public key derivation using 32-byte inputs, ensuring cryptographic integrity. Operations include signing a message with a secret key and validating the signature with a public key. Data types include 32-byte and 12-byte arrays, with functions for error-aware encoding and cryptographic validation.

Generates random byte sequences of a specified length, using an optional identifier for deterministic testing. Operates on integers and strings to produce Bytes.t values. Used to create reproducible test data when needed, and secure random values in production.

Provides functions for key exchange, message encryption, and authentication using the KBB2017 protocol. Operates on cryptographic keys, session states, and encrypted message payloads. Enables secure communication channels in applications requiring end-to-end encryption and verified identity.

Generates random byte sequences of a specified length, using an optional identifier for deterministic testing. Operates on integers and strings to produce Bytes.t values. Used in scenarios requiring secure or testable random data generation, such as cryptographic key creation or unique identifier generation.
